climbs.name: There's A Thorn In My Ass

content.description: There are only a few committing moves, otherwise it's a sketchy, exposed scramble. The view and exposure are the only things keeping this route from being one star. Any wind at the campsite is exaggerated a considerable amount as air whips through the small valley below. Lots of larger, unsecured boulders abound on this rock. Try not to crush your belayer and wear a helmet.
content.protection: Ample spots for protection. Cams up to 2" but some great nut placements as well.
content.location: Sling the pine tree at the top of the route to rap off or find the sketchy downclimb.
